README: Add instructions for building native binaries
res: Add new multiarch binaries

Api: Install new multiarch binaries

Check Build.CPU_ABI to determine whether to install ARM, x86, or MIPS
binaries for busybox/iptables/nflog.  Also, store a new 'appVersion'
shared preference so that we know when the app has been upgraded.
On each upgrade (and only after an upgrade) we will check to see if
the native binaries need to be updated.
afwallstart: Switch from iptables_armv5 to iptables
res: Remove old ARM binaries

Api: Clean up iptables/busybox binary selection

Now that we have builtin iptables and ip6tables binaries for all
architectures, allow the user to enable them even if the device is ICS+.
Default is to use the system binaries for ICS+ (as before).

travis build
Update .travis.yml
Updated with travis build

RulesActivity: Use ACTION_SENDTO intent to send email

This is an attempt to improve compatibility with K-9 mail (bug #212).
ACTION_VIEW did not populate the message body.

external: Delete source dirs before re-extracting tarballs

If the timestamp on the dist/ tarball gets changed (e.g. via git rebase),
it can cause the $(IPTABLES_SRC)/configure or $(BUSYBOX_BUILD)/.unpacked
targets to get re-invoked.  These should start with a clean source
directory to avoid patch conflicts on 'newly added' files like
libxt_quota2.c.
external: iptables: Add workaround for broken HTC One SV libc

RulesActivity: Show device make/model/build

This allows us to track whether certain brands or ROMs have the same
bugs.

ConnectivityChangeReceiver: Handle AP change as a connectivity change

We might not get a CONNECTIVITY_CHANGE event when the AP status changes,
so recheck the interface configuration on WIFI_AP_STATE_CHANGED events
too.
InterfaceTracker: Report isWifiApEnabled status every time it is read
